name: Mule Core
description: Mule Runtime and Integration Platform: Core components

operations.name: collectionAggregator

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Defines a timeout in Milliseconds to wait for events to be aggregated. By default the router will throw an exeception if the router is waiting for a correlation group and times out before all group enties are received.

parameters.name: failOnTimeout
parameters.description: When false, incomplete aggregation groups will be forwarded to a component on timeout as a java.util.List. When true (default), a CorrelationTimeoutException is thrown and RoutingNotification.CORRELATION_TIMEOUT is fired. The component doesn't receive any messages in this case.

parameters.name: processedGroupsObjectStore
parameters.description: The object store where the processed groups are going to be stored. It is recommended that this object store has a max capacity and an expiration interval.

parameters.name: eventGroupsObjectStore
parameters.description: The object store where the event groups are going to be stored.

parameters.name: persistentStores
parameters.description: Defines if the object stores used are persistent or not. This will only be used for the internally that this object store has a max capacity and an expiration interval.

parameters.name: storePrefix
parameters.description: Defines the prefix of the object store names. This will only be used for the internally built object stores.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.description: Configures a Collection Response Router. This will return a MuleMessageCollection message type that will contain all messages received for a each correlation group. exeception if the router is waiting for a correlation group and times out before all group enties are received. java.util.List. When true (default), a CorrelationTimeoutException is thrown and RoutingNotification.CORRELATION_TIMEOUT is fired. The component doesn't receive any messages in this case. that this object store has a max capacity and an expiration interval. built object stores. stores.

operations.name: collectionSplitter

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.description: The collection splitter accepts a collection of objects and splits the collection invoking the next message processor with each item in the collection in sequence.

operations.name: logger

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message that will be logged. Embedded expressions can be used to extract value from the current message. If no message is specified then the current message is used.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The log category to be used

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The logging level to be used. Default is DEBUG.

operations.description: Performs logging using an expression that determines what should be logged. By default the current messages is logged using the DEBUG level to the 'org.mule.runtime.core.api.processor.LoggerMessageProcessor' category but the level and category can both be configured to suit your needs. message is specified then the current message is used.

operations.name: splitter

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: filterOnErrorType
parameters.description: A comma separated list of error types that should be handled by dropping the split part. These errors are handled so that items that cause them when being processed won't be included in the aggregated response collection, rather than propagating the error. This is useful to use validations inside this component.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.description: The simple splitter splits incoming message into parts using the configured expression passing on each part in turn to the next message processor.

operations.name: filter

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: The name of the filter to use.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: the message to execute on the referenced flow

operations.description: A filter that is defined elsewhere (at the global level, or as a Spring bean).

operations.name: idempotentMessageValidator

parameters.name: idExpression
parameters.description: Defines one or more expressions to use when extracting the ID from the message. If this property is not set, '#[id]' will be used by default.

parameters.name: valueExpression
parameters.description: Defines one or more expressions to use when extracting the value from the message.

parameters.name: objectStore
parameters.description: The object store where the IDs of the processed events are going to be stored.

parameters.name: storePrefix
parameters.description: Defines the prefix of the object store names. This will only be used for the internally built object store.

operations.description: Ensures that only unique messages are received by a service by checking the unique ID of the incoming message. Note that the ID used can be generated from the message using an expression defined in the 'idExpression' attribute. Otherwise, a 'FILTERED' error is generated.

operations.name: flowRef

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the flow to call

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: the message to execute on the referenced flow

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.description: Allows a 'flow' to be referenced such that the message processing will continue in the referenced flow before returning. Message processing in the referenced 'flow' will occur within the context of the referenced flow and will therefore use its exception strategy etc.

operations.name: foreach

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: An expression to that returns a java collection, object array, map or DOM nodes.

parameters.name: batchSize
parameters.description: Partitions the collection in subcollections of the specified size.

parameters.name: rootMessageVariableName
parameters.description: Property name where the parent message is stored.

parameters.name: counterVariableName
parameters.description: Property name used to store the number of message being iterated.

parameters.name: ignoreErrorType
parameters.description: A comma separated list of error types that should be handled by dropping the split part. These errors are handled so that items that cause them when being processed are ignored, rather than propagating the error. This is useful to use validations inside this component.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operations.description: The foreach Processor allows iterating over a collection payload, or any collection obtained by an expression, generating a message for each element.

operations.name: choice

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: The expression to evaluate.

operations.description: Sends the message to the first message processor whose condition has been satisfied. If no conditions were satisfied, sends to the configured default message processor if configured, or throws an exception if not configured.

operations.name: scatterGather

parameters.name: parallel
parameters.description: Whether the configured routes will run in parallel (default is true).

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Sets a timeout in milliseconds for each route. Values lower or equals than zero means no timeout.

parameters.name: custom-aggregation-strategy
parameters.description: Allows customizing the logic used for aggregation the events back together.

operations.description: Sends the same message to multiple message processors in parallel.

operations.name: async
operations.description: Processes the nested list of message processors asynchronously using a thread pool

operations.name: try

parameters.name: transactionalAction
parameters.description: The action to take regarding transactions. By default nothing will be done.

parameters.name: transactionType
parameters.description: Transaction type supported. Availability will depend on the runtime version, though LOCAL is always available.

operations.description: The try Processor executes the nested list of message processors, within a transaction and with it's own error handler if required.

operations.name: errorHandler
operations.description: Allows the definition of internal selective handlers. It will route the error to the first handler that matches it. If there's no match, then a default error handler will be executed.

operations.name: onErrorContinue

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The full name of the error type to match against or a comma separated list of full names, to match against any of them.

parameters.name: when
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: logException
parameters.description: Determines whether the handled exception will be logged to its standard logger in the ERROR level before being handled. Default is true.

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Determines whether ExceptionNotifications will be fired from this strategy when an exception occurs. Default is true.

operations.description: Error handler used to handle exceptions. It will commit any transaction as if the message was consumed successfully.

operations.name: onErrorPropagate

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The full name of the error type to match against or a comma separated list of full names, to match against any of them.

parameters.name: when
parameters.description: The expression that will be evaluated to determine if this exception strategy should be executed. This should always be a boolean expression.

parameters.name: logException
parameters.description: Determines whether the handled exception will be logged to its standard logger in the ERROR level before being handled. Default is true.

parameters.name: enableNotifications
parameters.description: Determines whether ExceptionNotifications will be fired from this strategy when an exception occurs. Default is true.

operations.description: Error handler used to propagate errors. It will rollback any transaction and not consume messages.

messageSources.name: scheduler
messageSources.description: Source that schedules periodic execution of a flow.
